tool_description: A single API for hundreds of green energy devices. Easily connect to and control your customers’ electric vehicles, thermostats, solar panels, batteries and more.
name: Enode API
title: Enode API

api_list.name: listHVACs
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://enode-api.p.rapidapi.com/hvacs"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "enode-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://enode-api.p.rapidapi.com/hvacs"

        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

portalName.description: The name of the first party service or app that the user normally logs into.

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",

        }

print(response.json())

schema.description: [Smart Charging](/docs/smart-charging/introduction) configuration properties. Configured via the [Update Smart Charging Policy](/api/reference#updateVehicleSmartChargingPolicy) endpoint.

isEnabled.description: When enabled, this vehicle's charging status may be controlled by [Smart Charging](/docs/smart-charging/introduction)

deadline.description: The deadline for fully charging the vehicle. Smart charging does not work without setting a deadline. The deadline is expressed as a time on a 24h clock in UTC

api_list.name: getStatisticsProduction
api_list.description: Returns a normalized time series of statistics about power production and price for the User.

required_parameters.name: startDate
required_parameters.description: Earliest date to include in the response. Cannot be greater than endDate.

optional_parameters.name: id
optional_parameters.description: Filter statistics to only include a specific entity. Hardware category of the entity must match the `type` parameter.

optional_parameters.name: resolution
optional_parameters.description: The unit of time the data will be cut into before aggregate statistics are applied. Each entry in the response array corresponds to aggregated data of the time range specified.

optional_parameters.name: endDate
optional_parameters.description: Latest date to include in the response (defaults to current date/time).

optional_parameters.name: chargingLocationId
optional_parameters.description: Filter statistics to only include this charging location.

optional_parameters.name: utcOffset
optional_parameters.description: Offset (in hours) from UTC of the timezone from which the statistics should be viewed. By default, all returned timestamps are in UTC, and period boundaries (day, week, month, year) used in the aggregation are calculated in UTC. Providing `utcOffset` instead aligns these to the viewer's timezone so that the timestamps and period boundaries fall where the viewer expects them to. Positive, negative, and fractional values are valid.

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: Get statistics for this hardware type.

kw.description: Aggregate statistics for charge rate in kW

price.description: Aggregate statistics for power price (<CURRENCY> per kWh)

date.description: The start date of this sample within the timeseries

name.description: User-supplied name for the Charging Location

timezoneName.description: An IANA TZ database timezone name. This value will be used to convert rules and deadlines for tariffs, smart charging, and schedules into local time. Defaults to 'UTC'.

api_list.name: getVehiclesVehicleid

optional_parameters.name: field[]
optional_parameters.description:
If you specify any fields here, we make a request to the Vehicle's OEM APIs and return the updated data.

 This will slow down your integration. In cases of vendor downtime requests with fields may take up to a minute to complete, while requests without fields will always be fast. Enode polls all devices connected to our platform, so any cached data returned will not be older than 10 minutes (unless the vendor APIs are unavailable, in which case you can consult the `lastSeen` & `isReachable` fields on the vehicle).

By default, no fields are included, and the latest cached full Vehicle object will be returned.

lastSeen.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp at which live data was last available from Enode's perspective.

isReachable.description: Whether live data from the vehicle is currently available from Enode's perspective. This 'reachability' may refer to reading from a cache operated by the vehicle's cloud service if that service has determined that its cache is valid.

chargingLocationId.description: ID of the charging location the vehicle is currently positioned at (if any).

id.description: The vendor's vehicle ID. Sometimes the same as the VIN. This value is deprecated because it changes over time. Do not use this value to refer to vehicles.

chargeState.description: Information about the electric or hybrid battery.

isPluggedIn.description: Indicates whether the vehicle is connected to a charging box (regardless of whether it is actually charging)

isCharging.description: Current charging status of the vehicle

isFullyCharged.description: Indicates whether the vehicle is fully charged. 'Fully charged' may be a `batteryLevel` of less than 100 if a maximum charge ceiling has been configured in the vehicle.

batteryCapacity.description: Vehicle's maximum physical battery capacity in kWh. This number slowly decreases/degrades over time.

chargeLimit.description: Charge limit, as a percent of `batteryCapacity`.

chargeRate.description:
The current charge rate in kW.

This property is only available when the vehicle is charging, and is `null` any other time.

chargeTimeRemaining.description:
Estimated time until the current charging intent is completed, in minutes.

This property is only available when the vehicle is charging, and is `null` any other time.

lastUpdated.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp of last received charge state update

smartChargingPolicy.description: [Smart Charging](/docs/smart-charging/introduction) configuration properties. Configured via the [Update Smart Charging Policy](/api/reference#updateVehicleSmartChargingPolicy) endpoint.

isEnabled.description: When enabled, this vehicle's charging status may be controlled by [Smart Charging](/docs/smart-charging/introduction)

deadline.description: The deadline for fully charging the vehicle. Smart charging does not work without setting a deadline. The deadline is expressed as a time on a 24h clock in UTC

lastUpdated.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp of last received location
ISO8601 UTC timestamp of last received odometer update

capabilities.description: A collection of descriptors that describe the capabilities of this specific vehicle

allOf.description: Full availability of chargeState data.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Full availability of location data.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Full availability of information data.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Full availability of odometer data.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Support for START charging command

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Support for STOP charging command

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Support for smartCharging. This value is dynamic and may change over time.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

api_list.name: getHVAC
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://enode-api.p.rapidapi.com/hvacs/<string>"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "enode-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://enode-api.p.rapidapi.com/hvacs/{hvacid}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "enode-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

allOf.description: Target mode for an HVAC device
HVAC Mode
The HVAC's mode.

heatSetpoint.description: If mode allows, heat when `currentTemperature` falls below this point.

coolSetpoint.description: If mode allows, cool when `currentTemperature` rises above this point.

holdType.description: The duration the setpoints and mode are expected to be held. If `SCHEDULED`, the device is being controlled by an OEM schedule configured on the device.

allOf.title: HVAC Vendor
allOf.description: HVAC Vendor

lastSeen.description: The last time the HVAC unit was successfully communicated with

isReachable.description: Whether live data from the HVAC unit is currently fetchable from Enode's perspective. It can happen that this 'reachability' refers to reading from a cache operated by the vendor's cloud service, if that service has determined that its cache is valid.

chargingLocationId.description: ID of the charging location the HVAC unit is housed at (if any)

isActive.description: Whether the HVAC unit is actively heating or cooling.

currentTemperature.description: Current air temperature reported by device in degrees Celsius.

targetTemperature.description: Replaced with `coolSetpoint` and `heatSetpoint`. A future release will remove this field. Target temperature for a HVAC device.

deadband.description:
Size of the optional deadband centered around `temperature`.

For example, with a `temperature` of 22.0 and a `deadband` of 4.0, an HVAC unit will receive a heating setpoint of 20.0 and a cooling setpoint of 24.0

consumptionRate.description: The current rate of energy consumption in kW. An inactive HVAC will have a consumption rate of 0. This value is currently experimental and is typically estimated with a large margin of error.

allOf.description: Descriptive information about the HVAC unit

displayName.description: Name of the device, as set by the user on the device/vendor. If no user-specified name is available, we construct a fallback name using the vendor/device/model names.

groupName.description: Name of the group the device belongs to, as set by the user on the device/vendor. Groups are typically presented as "rooms" or "zones".

capabilities.description: An object describing valid states for this HVAC device.

capableModes.description: A list of valid modes for this HVAC device.

capableHoldTypes.description: A list of valid hold types for this HVAC device.

items.description: The duration the setpoints and mode are expected to be held. If `SCHEDULED`, the device is being controlled by an OEM schedule configured on the device.

allOf.description: The range of allowable values for `coolSetpoint`.
The range of allowable values for `heatSetpoint`.
A range describing how close `heatSetpoint` and `coolSetpoint` can be. Only relevant in `AUTO` mode.

api_list.name: getVehicles
api_list.description:
List all available Vehicles for the User.

If you already know the ID of a vehicle you want to fetch, it is recommended to fetch it using the more performant [Get Vehicle](/api/reference#getVehiclesVehicleid) method.

optional_parameters.name: field[]
optional_parameters.description:
If you specify any fields here, we make a request to the Vehicle's OEM APIs and return the updated data.

 This will slow down your integration. In cases of vendor downtime requests with fields may take up to a minute to complete, while requests without fields will always be fast. Enode polls all devices connected to our platform, so any cached data returned will not be older than 10 minutes (unless the vendor APIs are unavailable, in which case you can consult the `lastSeen` & `isReachable` fields on the vehicle).

By default, no fields are included, and the latest cached full Vehicle object will be returned.

lastSeen.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp at which live data was last available from Enode's perspective.

isReachable.description: Whether live data from the vehicle is currently available from Enode's perspective. This 'reachability' may refer to reading from a cache operated by the vehicle's cloud service if that service has determined that its cache is valid.

chargingLocationId.description: ID of the charging location the vehicle is currently positioned at (if any).

id.description: The vendor's vehicle ID. Sometimes the same as the VIN. This value is deprecated because it changes over time. Do not use this value to refer to vehicles.

chargeState.description: Information about the electric or hybrid battery.

isPluggedIn.description: Indicates whether the vehicle is connected to a charging box (regardless of whether it is actually charging)

isCharging.description: Current charging status of the vehicle

isFullyCharged.description: Indicates whether the vehicle is fully charged. 'Fully charged' may be a `batteryLevel` of less than 100 if a maximum charge ceiling has been configured in the vehicle.

batteryCapacity.description: Vehicle's maximum physical battery capacity in kWh. This number slowly decreases/degrades over time.

chargeLimit.description: Charge limit, as a percent of `batteryCapacity`.

chargeRate.description:
The current charge rate in kW.

This property is only available when the vehicle is charging, and is `null` any other time.

chargeTimeRemaining.description:
Estimated time until the current charging intent is completed, in minutes.

This property is only available when the vehicle is charging, and is `null` any other time.

lastUpdated.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp of last received charge state update

smartChargingPolicy.description: [Smart Charging](/docs/smart-charging/introduction) configuration properties. Configured via the [Update Smart Charging Policy](/api/reference#updateVehicleSmartChargingPolicy) endpoint.

isEnabled.description: When enabled, this vehicle's charging status may be controlled by [Smart Charging](/docs/smart-charging/introduction)

deadline.description: The deadline for fully charging the vehicle. Smart charging does not work without setting a deadline. The deadline is expressed as a time on a 24h clock in UTC

lastUpdated.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp of last received location
ISO8601 UTC timestamp of last received odometer update

capabilities.description: A collection of descriptors that describe the capabilities of this specific vehicle

allOf.description: Full availability of chargeState data.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Full availability of location data.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Full availability of information data.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Full availability of odometer data.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Support for START charging command

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

api_list.name: getInverter

optional_parameters.name: field[]
optional_parameters.description:
If you specify any fields here, we make a request to the Solar inverter's OEM APIs and return the updated data.

 This will slow down your integration. In cases of vendor downtime requests with fields may take up to a minute to complete, while requests without fields will always be fast. Enode polls all devices connected to our platform, so any cached data returned will not be older than 10 minutes (unless the vendor APIs are unavailable, in which case you can consult the `lastSeen` & `isReachable` fields on the solar inverter).

By default, no fields are included, and the latest cached full solar inverter object will be returned.

allOf.title: Inverter Vendor
allOf.description: Inverter Vendor

chargingLocationId.description: ID of the charging location the solar inverter is currently positioned at (if any).

lastSeen.description: The last time the solar inverter was successfully communicated with

isReachable.description: Whether live data from the solar inverter is currently fetchable from Enode's perspective. This 'reachability' may refer to reading from a cache operated by the solar inverter's cloud service if that service has determined that its cache is valid.

productionRate.description: The current production rate in kW.

isProducing.description: Whether the solar inverter is actively producing energy or not.

lastUpdated.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp of last received production state update

information.description: Descriptive information about the solar inverter

siteName.description: Name of the site, as set by the user on the device/vendor. If no user-specified name is available, we construct a fallback name using the vendor/device/model names.

location.description: Solar inverter's GPS coordinates with timestamp

api_list.name: getVehiclesVehicleidSmartchargingstatus
api_list.description: Every vehicle in Enode has a [SmartChargingStatus](/docs/smart-charging/introduction) object that describes the vehicle in terms of smart charging.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://enode-api.p.rapidapi.com/vehicles/<string>/smart-charging-status"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "enode-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://enode-api.p.rapidapi.com/vehicles/{vehicleid}/smart-charging-status"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "enode-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

updatedAt.description: Time at which the SmartChargingStatus object was recalculated, whether or not any values actually changed

state.description: An enum value that describes the current SmartCharging state of the vehicle. Every vehicle is in exactly one state, at all times

stateChangedAt.description: Time at which the the 'state' property transitioned to its current value

consideration.description: `null` by default, but during the `CONSIDERING` state, the value is populated with a list of all the requirements that must be true before a plan will be created

recentlyAtChargingLocation.description: The vehicle is located at a configured Charging Location

hasTimeEstimate.description: A good estimate is available of how much time it will take to charge.

confidentTimeEstimate.description: To be removed soon. Use hasTimeEstimate instead.

needsSignificantCharge.description: The charge needed is greater than 60 minutes and greater than 5% of total battery capacity

hasChargeAboveThreshold.description: The battery is already at least 20% charged

singleUser.description: Only 1 User has this vehicle actively connected to Enode. Nearly always true in real use cases, but can be an issue for vehicles used in testing/development/integration.

wontStopExistingChargingSession.description: If charging started before the previous deadline, we assume vehicle should be left charging, and we will not create a charge plan. For example, if you start charging a vehicle at 03:00 with a deadline of 06:00 and 6 hours remaining, `wontStopExistingChargingSession` will be false once the deadline is passed. It resets to true the next time you plug in your car.

atChargingLocation.description: The vehicle is located at a configured Charging Location

locationIsFresh.description: The GPS location of the vehicle is recently updated and trustworthy

confidentBatteryCapacity.description: The calculated battery capacity is confidently known or estimated

needsCharge.description: The vehicle's battery is not fully charged

priceDataAvailable.description: Price data is available for the current charging location

minimumSavings.description: The savings of a possible plan are above a configurable threshold

minimumDelay.description: The resulting delay of a possible plan is above 30 minutes

isNormalSchedule.description: If charging started before the previous deadline, we assume vehicle should be left charging, and we will not create a charge plan. For example, if you start charging a vehicle at 03:00 with a deadline of 06:00 and 6 hours remaining, isNormalSchedule will be false once the deadline is passed. It resets to true the next time you plug in your car.

chargingLocationId.description: ID of the charging location at which the plan is being executed. Null for plans started before March 2022.

vehicleId.description: ID of the Vehicle to which the Plan belongs

userId.description: ID of the User to which the Plan belongs

vendor.description: Vendor of the Vehicle to which the Plan belongs

currency.description: Currency in which monetary amounts are denominated (ISO 4217 3-character Alpha code)

allOf.description: Estimated cost of default charging behavior
Estimated cost achieved by this Smart Charge plan

stopAt.description: Time at which the vehicle will stop charging

startAt.description: Time at which the vehicle will start charging

estimatedFinishAt.description: Time at which charging is estimated to be complete

stopConfirmedAt.description: Time at which the vehicle's charging was confirmed as stopped.

startConfirmedAt.description: Time at which the vehicle's charging was confirmed as started.

endedAt.description: The actual time at which the plan ended

finalState.description: The final state of the plan when it ended

failureCondition.description: If the finalState was PLAN:ENDED:FAILED, failureCondition is populated with the condition in which the plan failed.

allOf.description: `null` by default, but during all of the `PLAN:*` states,  the value is populated with a description of the active plan

externalStart.description: This field is only populated after calling the [vehicle](/api/reference#vehicleCreateExternalStart) or [charger](/api/reference#chargerCreateExternalStart) External Start APIs. While this parameter is populated, the parent charge controller will remain in an overridden state and will not attempt to send actions to the target. The External Start override remains in place until the target stops charging for any reason, or until the External Start is ended via the Delete [vehicle](/api/reference#vehicleEndExternalStart) or [charger](/api/reference#chargerEndExternalStart) External Start APIs.

createdAt.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp at which the external start was created.

endedAt.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp at which the external start was ended. If null, the External Start override is still active.

targetType.description: The Vendor Type of the target entity this External Start is referencing.

allOf.description: ID of the asset (Vehicle or Charger) to which this External Start applies.

vendorActionId.description: The ID of Vendor Action responsible for starting charging on the target. Use the [Vehicle Get Action](/api/reference#getVehiclesAction) or the [Charger Get Action](/api/reference#getChargersAction) endpoints to monitor action results.

allOf.description: A Schedule that applies to the combination of a certain Charging Location and chargeable asset (Vehicle/Charger/HVAC). Read the guide to [Using Schedules](/docs/scheduling).

defaultShouldCharge.description: Default value of `shouldCharge` when no rule applies.

rules.description: Each rule sets a value for `shouldCharge`, either `true` or `false`. All other properties of the rule are optional filters that limit the times to which this rule applies.

hourMinute.description: An interval composed of two clock times during which this rule applies each day. `to` always resolves to a timestamp after `from`, and thus may span across midnight and fall on the next day.

from.description: Clock time from which this rule should apply each day.

to.description: Clock time until which this rule should apply each day.

fromTimestamp.description: UTC timestamp from which this rule should apply.

toTimestamp.description: UTC timestamp until which this rule should apply.

weekdays.description: An array of weekdays to which this rule should apply. A weekday starts with 0 for Monday and ends with 6 for Sunday.

shouldCharge.description: Whether a chargeable asset should want to charge while this rule is active.

allOf.description: HVAC target temperature while this rule is active.
Replaced with `coolSetpoint` and `heatSetpoint`. A future release will remove this field. Target temperature for a HVAC device.

deadband.description:
Size of the optional deadband centered around `temperature`.

For example, with a `temperature` of 22.0 and a `deadband` of 4.0, an HVAC unit will receive a heating setpoint of 20.0 and a cooling setpoint of 24.0

rules.description: Each rule sets a value for `targetTemperature`. All other properties of the rule are optional filters that limit the times to which this rule applies.

hourMinute.description: An interval composed of two clock times during which this rule applies each day. `to` always resolves to a timestamp after `from`, and thus may span across midnight and fall on the next day.

from.description: Clock time from which this rule should apply each day.

to.description: Clock time until which this rule should apply each day.

fromTimestamp.description: UTC timestamp from which this rule should apply.

toTimestamp.description: UTC timestamp until which this rule should apply.

weekdays.description: An array of weekdays to which this rule should apply. A weekday starts with 0 for Monday and ends with 6 for Sunday.

allOf.description: HVAC target temperature while this rule is active.
Replaced with `coolSetpoint` and `heatSetpoint`. A future release will remove this field. Target temperature for a HVAC device.

deadband.description:
Size of the optional deadband centered around `temperature`.

For example, with a `temperature` of 22.0 and a `deadband` of 4.0, an HVAC unit will receive a heating setpoint of 20.0 and a cooling setpoint of 24.0

allOf.description: ID of the asset (Vehicle/Charger/HVAC) to which this schedule applies
ID of the Charging Location to which this schedule applies. If null, schedule is applied at all of the User's Charging Locations.

isEnabled.description: Whether this Schedule should be attempting to control the target's charge state.

changedAt.description: Time at which any value of the status last changed

state.description: An enum value that describes the current state of the Schedule

isCharging.description: Whether the target is currently actually charging

isChargingExpected.description: Whether the target is currently expected to be charging

isChargingExpectedParts.description: Collection of booleans that - when combined via AND operator - forms the `isChargingExpected` value

upcomingTransitions.description: List of upcoming transitions of the `shouldCharge` or `targetTemperature` value. A maximum of 2 items are returned.

externalStart.description: This field is only populated after calling the [vehicle](/api/reference#vehicleCreateExternalStart) or [charger](/api/reference#chargerCreateExternalStart) External Start APIs. While this parameter is populated, the parent charge controller will remain in an overridden state and will not attempt to send actions to the target. The External Start override remains in place until the target stops charging for any reason, or until the External Start is ended via the Delete [vehicle](/api/reference#vehicleEndExternalStart) or [charger](/api/reference#chargerEndExternalStart) External Start APIs.

createdAt.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp at which the external start was created.

endedAt.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp at which the external start was ended. If null, the External Start override is still active.

targetType.description: The Vendor Type of the target entity this External Start is referencing.

allOf.description: ID of the asset (Vehicle or Charger) to which this External Start applies.

vendorActionId.description: The ID of Vendor Action responsible for starting charging on the target. Use the [Vehicle Get Action](/api/reference#getVehiclesAction) or the [Charger Get Action](/api/reference#getChargersAction) endpoints to monitor action results.

api_list.name: getStatisticsCharging
api_list.description:
Returns a normalized time series of statistics about power consumption and price for the User.

If Smart Charging has shifted the consumption, the 'non-smart' price fields will show what the consumption would have cost if it had happened at the default time. The difference between the two is provided by the `estimatedSavings` field for convenience. `<CURRENCY>` is an ISO4217 Alpha-3 currency code that is determined by client-wide configuration or the currency code provided during price data ingestion (such as Tariffs).

required_parameters.name: startDate
required_parameters.description: Earliest date to include in the response. Cannot be greater than endDate.

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: Get statistics for this hardware type.

optional_parameters.name: id
optional_parameters.description: Filter statistics to only include a specific entity. Hardware category of the entity must match the `type` parameter.

optional_parameters.name: utcOffset
optional_parameters.description: Offset (in hours) from UTC of the timezone from which the statistics should be viewed. By default, all returned timestamps are in UTC, and period boundaries (day, week, month, year) used in the aggregation are calculated in UTC. Providing `utcOffset` instead aligns these to the viewer's timezone so that the timestamps and period boundaries fall where the viewer expects them to. Positive, negative, and fractional values are valid.

optional_parameters.name: resolution
optional_parameters.description: The unit of time the data will be cut into before aggregate statistics are applied. Each entry in the response array corresponds to aggregated data of the time range specified.

optional_parameters.name: chargingLocationId
optional_parameters.description: Filter statistics to only include this charging location.

optional_parameters.name: endDate
optional_parameters.description: Latest date to include in the response (defaults to current date/time).

kw.description: Aggregate statistics for charge rate in kW

price.description: Aggregate statistics for power price (<CURRENCY> per kWh)

nonSmartPrice.description: Aggregate statistics for power price (<CURRENCY> per kWh), calculated as if the charging had ocurred uninterrupted without being delayed by Smart Charging

nonSmartCostSum.description: Total cost for this consumption in <CURRENCY>, if it had not been shifted by Smart Charging

estimatedSavings.description: Total estimated savings in <CURRENCY>, achieved by Smart Charging

date.description: The start date of this sample within the timeseries

rules.description: Each rule sets a value for `shouldCharge`, either `true` or `false`. All other properties of the rule are optional filters that limit the times to which this rule applies.

allOf.description: HVAC target temperature while this rule is active.

api_list.name: getCharger

optional_parameters.name: field[]
optional_parameters.description:
If you specify any fields here, we make a request to the Charger's OEM APIs and return the updated data.

 This will slow down your integration. In cases of vendor downtime requests with fields may take up to a minute to complete, while requests without fields will always be fast. Enode polls all devices connected to our platform, so any cached data returned will not be older than 10 minutes (unless the vendor APIs are unavailable, in which case you can consult the `lastSeen` & `isReachable` fields on the charger).

By default, no fields are included, and the latest cached full Charger object will be returned.

lastSeen.description: The last time the charger was successfully communicated with

isReachable.description: Whether live data from the charger is currently fetchable from Enode's perspective. This 'reachability' may refer to reading from a cache operated by the charger's cloud service if that service has determined that its cache is valid.

chargingLocationId.description: ID of the charging location the charger is currently positioned at (if any).

isPluggedIn.description: Indicates whether the charger has a vehicle plugged into it (regardless of whether that vehicle is actually charging)

chargeRate.description:
The current charge rate in kW.

This property is only available when the charger is actively charging a vehicle, and is `null` any other time.

lastUpdated.description: ISO8601 UTC timestamp of last received charge state update

maxCurrent.description: Desired max current in ampere, if set

capabilities.description: A collection of descriptors that describe the capabilities of this specific charger

allOf.description: Full availability of information data.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Full availability of chargeState data.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Supports START charging command.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Supports STOP charging command.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.

allOf.description: Ability to set the max charge rate.

isCapable.description: The entity is fully capable of providing this data or functionality. If false, support is partial or missing.

interventionIds.description: IDs of interventions the user can make to alter the availability of this capability. See [the interventions reference](/docs/connections/interventions#available-interventions) for all possible values.
